Recap: Adriana finds out that her mother has been scheming to keep her in Paris and prevent her from marrying Rex. And she is furious. Dorian also has some "business" with the mayor. Jared and Charlie relive the very ill situation of his abusive stepfather hurting him and his little brother. And Jared feels responsible for his little brother running out into the street and getting killed. Starr admits to her dad that she went to see Marcie McBain to inform her that she wanted Marcie to take Sam away from her dad because he's unfit to raise him. And while Blair and Todd are out, Starr's friends arrange for Cole to come to the house to see her in secret. Everybody is happy about Rex and Adriana getting married except for Gigi.
Transcript: [Knock on door]
Adriana: Oh, that better not be my mother again.
Layla: Welcome home!
Adriana: Hi!
Layla: Hey, baby.
Adriana: I missed you.
Layla: I missed you, too.
Adriana: What's that?
Layla: Oh, the sample fall line is in. I thought you might want to take a look at it while you're in town.
Adriana: Ooh.
Layla: Mm-hmm.
Rex: I wouldn't mind taking a look myself.
[Layla chuckles]
Layla: I'll go.
Adriana: No.
Rex: No, no. You guys need to do this. I'll have you all to myself soon enough.
Adriana: Hmm.
Layla: Did you guys finally set a date?
Adriana: Are you free May 9?
Layla: Really?
Adriana: Uh-huh.
Layla: Oh, my God! That's the best news, ever.
Adriana: Yeah!
Layla: Yay!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marcie: What the heck is this? Please do not tell me you got fired from B.E. already.
Gigi: No! Viki and I are just helping Carlotta out.
Marcie: Oh. Huh.
Gigi: Where's Shane?
Marcie: Oh, he's sleeping. Michael's with him.
Gigi: I hate to keep imposing. Michael will call me as soon as he wakes up, right?
Marcie: Definitely, definitely. So come on -- tell me, how is the big second day on the job?
Gigi: Oh, you know -- made copies, answered emails, faxed a bunch of stuff, spilled coffee, kissed the boss.
[Marcie laughs]
Marcie: All in a day's work, I guess. Oh, you're not kidding. Oh, my God, you're not kidding? You kissed Clint Buchanan?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dorian: So, times must be tough at "The Banner."
Viki: Oh, yes, had to sell it -- what a shame, huh? But fortunately, Carlotta gave me a job. And now, I've got these two great tippers at my table -- lucky girl am I! Mr. Mayor, a menu?
Mayor Lowell: Thank you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jared: You don't get it, do you? It wasn't an accident.
Charlie: What? No -- look, your mother told me that --
Jared: Oh, Mom -- Mom was scared to death, because you walked out on her and someone else took your place. And then she did and said whatever he told her to.
Charlie: Okay, so you're telling me that she lied?
Jared: She had to! He beat her! He beat all of us.
Charlie: Oh, my God. Look, I didn't know.
Jared: You didn't care. All you cared about was where your next bottle was coming from.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Todd: Starr, get down here!
Todd: Yeah, I thought I told you and McBain to keep Cole away from my daughter.
Nora: Hello to you, too, Todd.
Todd: If you can't control your ward of the court, I will.
Nora: And if you can't control your compulsion to threaten me, I'll sue. What do you want?
Todd: Starr was at Marcie McBain's today probably arranging a meeting with Cole. Right?
Nora: I don't know. You should ask Starr -- and spare me any more of your paranoid rants.
Todd: If Cole so much as I.M.s Starr --
Nora: Goodbye, Todd.
Blair: Was that you yelling?
Todd: Starr, get your butt down here!
Blair: What is wrong?
Todd: Well, first, I found Ramsey at the penthouse.
Blair: Yeah?
Todd: He's purchased it. Secondly, I found out Starr was at Marcie McBain's along with John McBain.

Todd: Yeah, and I know exactly what they were up to.
Starr: You don't know anything.

Langston: Cole, you need to talk. I mean, maybe it'd be easier if I wasn't there.

Markko: Yeah, you can. I know how to make it happen.

Adriana: Which is why we should be talking dresses ASAP.
Layla: Yes.

Dorian: Of course not. But do seem to have hit a sore spot.

Charlie: If you really want to hurt Viki so badly, why don't you just get it over with? Just tell her what Jared and I have done to her family.
Dorian: No, Viki's right. There are lots worse things than waitressing -- much worse.

Blair: Todd, come on. You think our daughter's going to set up a little secret rendezvous with Cole with --

Blair: Okay, stop, you two. Stop. Starr, you want to explain what you were doing over there at Marcie's? And I know that you like Mrs. McBain. She was one of your favorite teachers and you baby-sat for her, but can you just tell us what was going on?
Todd: All right, I'm calling the cops.
Starr: Dad, don't. Dad, please, stop it! I'll tell you the truth, okay? You want to hear it? I didn't go over to Mrs. McBain's for Cole, all right? I went there because of Sam.

Layla: For what?
Adriana: You got me. Rex had his headphones on. He was completely oblivious to the whole thing.

Adriana: No, because then my mother showed up.
Layla: And then I showed up.

Charlie: No -- what I'm saying is that it was me, Jared. I'm to blame. It's not your fault what happened to Jimmy!
Jared: Stop! Please.
Charlie: You -- you were just a kid, and you were a good kid and you didn't do anything wrong!
Jared: Yes, I did! I did everything wrong. I was his big brother. I should've protected him.

Langston: So how are we going to break Starr out?

Adriana: Oh. Jean-Pierre. Now what? Well, what fitting? No, look -- look, my partner Layla can be there. Okay, look, we've got it covered. Stop worrying. Goodbye.

Blair: I know that you want to protect her and so do I, but I don't think this is -- this is a good way of doing it.

Todd: Everywhere I turn, that son of a bitch Ramsey's in my face.

Todd: I'm not going to sit around and take it anymore. You know that "new Todd," "new and improved Todd" that never makes waves? He's history.

Blair: If we're going to make this marriage work, I don't want that old Todd back.

Charlie: How the hell were you supposed to protect him? Now, look, your mother called me that day and she told me that he just -- he just ran out into the middle of the street in front of that truck.
Jared: Yeah, and she just never told you why?
Charlie: Well -- well, she said you boys were just playing in the front yard.

Jared: Yeah. We were in the yard. We were in the yard to get away from him because he was inside screaming at Mom and Jimmy begged me to make it stop. But I couldn't. I didn't know what to do. So I -- I just hung on to him and I talked to him about baseball -- baseball -- or anything I could to drown out the yelling. And then the doors swung open and there he was screaming at us -- at me and Jimmy. "Get in the house!" We knew we were getting hit! And I could take it. I was fine. But I looked at him and -- and I could tell it was too much. He could not go back in that house. He was terrified. So I -- I just hung on to him. I hung on to him, Dad. But I couldn't, and he just --
Jared: He ran into the street.
Charlie: Oh, my God.
Jared: Yeah. I should've hung on to him.
Charlie: Well, Jared, you were 9 years old.
Jared: I was his big brother! I should've protected him!
Charlie: I was your father. I should've protected you both.

Cole: Okay, so what's going on?

Nora: You didn't try and see Starr tonight, did you, at the McBains'?

Nora: Thank you. Thank you very much.
Clint: Cole? I'd like to talk to you for a minute because Nora tells me that you're interested in engineering.

Cole: Yeah, that'd be great. Thanks.

Cole: Is that it?

Nora: God bless you.

Charlie: I'm the one who failed.

Jared: Huh. Well, I guess we're going to have to figure out how to make sure that time isn't spent sharing a jail cell.

Charlie: Well, hey, no, come on -- that's different. No, you -- you're not out to hurt these people. I know that. You were just looking for something to be a part of -- a family, which God knows we never had.

Chare: Uh -- yeah.
Jared: Yeah. I should probably get going, then.
Charlie: Yeah.

Charlie: Take care. Be good to yourself, son.

Layla: What about your mother? Adriana?

Layla: Sure. But in the meanwhile, you better get Rex back here and spend all the time you can with him before you have to go to Paris -- and stop thinking about Gigi.

Dorian: I'll be right there.
Adriana: Thanks.
Dorian: That was my daughter -- wedding emergency. I'm afraid I'm going to have to leave you, Mayor, and my tepid coffee.

Cole: Hey, where's Markko?

Todd's voice: Now, you got to stay away from him. If you don't, I'm going to make sure he goes to prison -- and then you'll never see him again, ever.

Adriana: No, not yet.
Dorian: Ah. Let me see here. Oh. Well, I -- are these, um, mother-of-the-bride dresses?
Adriana: Yes, they are.
Dorian: Um -- honey, I already have a dress in mind.
Adriana: I'm sure you do.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Charlie: I do miss Paris.
Viki: Do you ever wish that you were back there?
Charlie: Oh, no way, no. No, my son is here, you're here. Everything that I need is here.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Nora: Ah.
Clint: Okay, back to work.
Nora: Yes, well, it was nice to get away for a few minutes.
Clint: For the most part.
Nora: Yes -- for the most part.
Jared: Clint.
Clint: Hi.
Jared: Sorry to track you down here. I just -- I couldn't get you on your cell, so --
Clint: Ah. Now what's wrong?
Jared: Nothing. I just wanted to let you know the agreement with Kalto Industries came through.
Clint: Good. Good news for a change. Excellent work, Jared.
Jared: Thank you.
Nora: Are you okay, Jared?
Jared: Sure, yeah. Uh -- well, I can see that you guys are on your way out, but can I run one quick thing past you real quick?
Clint: Of course.
Nora: Uh -- you know what? I have to -- I'll go wait in the car. I got to get ahold of Matthew, make sure that he's doing homework, not video games or whatever.
Clint: I'll be there in a minute.
Nora: Okay.
Clint: Have a booth. Jared? Three minutes.
Jared: Right.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gigi: No champagne, so I brought you some celebratory chocolate cake.
Marcie: Mmm.
Layla: No, thank you.
Marcie: Mmm, I'll eat it.
Gigi: I'm really happy for you, Rex.
Rex: Thanks.
Layla: Actually, that reminds me -- Adriana put me in charge of vetting the guest list. Did you want to add Gigi?
Rex: Uh -- yeah. She's -- isn't she on it already?
Gigi: You don't have to.
Marcie: Oh, come on. Gigi, everybody loves a wedding.
Layla: Mm-hmm.
Marcie: Maybe you'll even catch the bouquet. Oh, can she bring a date? Are most of the Buchanans on that list, right? Are -- are you inviting Jared?
Jared: Moonlighting?
Rex: Speak of the devil.
Jared: Aren't we keeping you busy enough at B.E.?
Rex: You sure are.
Jared: What?
Rex: Nothing.
Gigi: Coffee?
Jared: No, thank you. This -- this suit was expensive.
[Gigi chuckles]
Gigi: I'm usually pretty good with coffee. And if you'd like, I could bring it to you every day with cream and sugar. I am your secretary, after all.
Jared: Huh, well --
Gigi: Excuse me  I got a customer.
Rex: What the hell's your problem?
Jared: What's yours?
Rex: [As Gigi] Coffee with cream and sugar?
Jared: I didn't ask for it. She offered.
Rex: [Normal voice] No, I heard, and we both know why. You're taking advantage of your position to string along a woman who needs a job because she's got a kid to support.
Jared: You want to start to make some sense?

Rex: Oh, right. First, you blackmail Jessica, then Nattie, into giving you a job, then you break my sister's heart. Then when it turns out you're magically related to both of them, you've moved on to Gigi. You get off jerking women around?
Jared: I would never hurt a woman.
Rex: Really? I hear that's all you do.
Jared: I'm going to get out of here.
Rex: Gigi needs someone she can count on, someone who won't let her down.
Jared: Oh, like you did?
Rex: Someone who could be a good dad to Shane, who won't let him down.
Jared: We're not dating, okay?

Rex: I've seen plenty of guys like you in my work -- a user. It starts here and then it goes straight downhill. First, you flatter the woman like hell, then you get her to fall in love with you, then you turn on her. Whoo! You feel angry and -- and -- and all that tension turns to hostility until finally you're beating her, you're hurting her, you're doing God 
[SCENE_BREAK]
Adriana: She sent me to Paris.
Dorian: "Paris," did you say? Oh, no, sweetheart. Uh-uh -- no way these dresses could be French. They're far too matronly.
Adriana: Actually, I think they're perfect, but no worries because you won't be wearing one.
Dorian: What do you mean? Is that my P.D.A.?
Adriana: Yes.
Dorian: Adriana --
Adriana: Don't you get righteous with me, you selfish bitch!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cole: All right, there go the guards, wish me luck.
Markko: No, no, no, wait! Dude, not yet.
Cole: You said I have three minutes.
Markko: No, something's off -- that guard was early. The girls aren't expecting it; the doors might not even be unlocked.
Cole: Wait, wait -- then what am I supposed to do?
Markko: Uh, wait for the guards to make one more loop around the grounds.
Cole: No, I'm tired of waiting. I'm doing this now.
Markko: Cole --
Cole: Hey, thanks for your help.
[Markko sighs]
[SCENE_BREAK]
[Knock on door]
Langston: It's me.
Starr: Look, Langston, I kind of want to be alone right now. You understand, right?
Langston: You're not going to be alone. Cole's coming. You're going to see him tonight.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Blair: You know, Todd, we really have to go to this party.
Todd: No, we don't, Blair.
Blair: Yes, we do. I'm sorry -- I know you were thinking that it's important --
Todd: I'm not leaving Starr by herself --
Blair: Well, I -- we need to go.
Todd: Ruin her life.
[NEXT_ON]
Adriana: You were the one who sent me to Paris, weren't you?
Gigi: It was one kiss. It's no big deal.
Jared: Until he made it one -- why?
Starr: Oh, no.
